result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven M Hauck

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.

8:56 AM Defendant Steven M Hauck in court.  Attorney Brian A Braziel in court for Steven M Hauck.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the time set for an arraignment. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and Amended Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts not guilty plea. 20 days to file motions that can be extended for good cause. Parties would like a status conference in 30-45 days. 
STC: 01/13/22 at 10am (30min) in person.

9:46 AM Defendant Steven M Hauck in court.  Attorney Brian A Braziel in court for Steven M Hauck.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Case referred to Br. 2 for scheduling an arraignment.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Brian Braziel at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $75 beginning 09/16/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with victim A.B., family or residence of A.B.

(11:47 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven M Hauck in court without counsel.
Defendant advises previously received a copy of the complaint and received a copy today, not sure if they are the same as didn't reviews today's copy.
Court advises defendant to sit down and take a few minutes to review the complaint.
(11:53 AM case re-called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven M Hauck in court without counsel.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 29, 2022 at 3:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
